newsitem.title: USA: National Steel targeted in pollution lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: National Steel targeted in pollution lawsuit.

text.p: The Michigan attorney general and the Michigan Department of Environmental Quality filed a lawsuit Wednesday accusing two plants owned by National Steel Corp of polluting the Detroit River.

The suit, filed in Ingham County Circuit Court, notes 75 alleged incidents in which the Mishawaka, Indiana-based company violated the terms of its water discharge permits over the past two years. The specific plants named in the suit are the Great Lakes Steel Ecorse Mill and the Zug Island Plant.
A National Steel spokesman told Reuters the company had not seen the lawsuit and declined comment.
National Steel processes about 5.5 million tons of flat-rolled steel products each year. It is a unit of NKK Corp.
The company's shares closed down 1/8 Wednesday at 9-3/4.
